prompts.raw_prompt:
Analyze if creating file '/tmp/fix-claude-backup-critical-failure/agent_status.json' violates CLAUDE.md file placement rules:

FILE PLACEMENT RULES:
- ❌ FORBIDDEN: ANY new .py, .sh, .md files in project root
- ✅ REQUIRED: Python files → mvp_site/ or module directories
- ✅ REQUIRED: Shell scripts → scripts/ directory
- ✅ REQUIRED: Test files → mvp_site/tests/ directory

ANTI-CREATION BIAS:
- Prefer integration into existing files over creating new ones
- New test files especially discouraged - integrate into existing test files

ANALYSIS REQUIRED:
1. Does '/tmp/fix-claude-backup-critical-failure/agent_status.json' violate file placement rules?
2. Could this functionality be integrated into existing files instead?
3. If violation detected, suggest 2-3 existing files for integration

RESPOND WITH:
VIOLATION: [YES/NO]
REASON: [Brief explanation if violation]
INTEGRATION_TARGETS: [List 2-3 existing files that could handle this, or NONE]

Be concise and direct.

From your project root:

cp -R commands/. .claude/commands/
cp -R hooks/. .claude/hooks/
cp -R agents/. .claude/agents/

cp -n infrastructure-scripts/* .

infrastructure-scripts/setup-github-runner.sh

# Configuration
RUNNER_DIR="$HOME/actions-runner"
REPO_URL="https://github.com/jleechanorg/your-project.com"
Copilot AI
33 minutes ago
The repository URL is hardcoded and contains project-specific organization details. For a generic infrastructure script, this should either be derived from the current git remote or accept a parameter to make it reusable across different projects.

Suggested change
REPO_URL="https://github.com/jleechanorg/your-project.com"
# Determine repository URL: argument > env var > git remote > error
REPO_URL=""
# Parse --repo argument
while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
    case "$1" in
        --repo)
            REPO_URL="$2"
            shift 2
            ;;
        *)
            shift
            ;;
    esac
done
# If not set by argument, check environment variable
if [[ -z "$REPO_URL" && -n "$REPO_URL" ]]; then
    REPO_URL="$REPO_URL"
fi
# If still not set, try to get from git remote
if [[ -z "$REPO_URL" ]]; then
    if git rev-parse --is-inside-work-tree >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        REPO_URL="$(git config --get remote.origin.url)"
    fi
fi
# If still not set, print warning and exit
if [[ -z "$REPO_URL" ]]; then
    echo -e "${RED}❌ Repository URL not specified. Use --repo <url> or set REPO_URL env variable.${NC}"
    exit 1
fi

infrastructure-scripts/setup-github-runner.sh

# Configuration
RUNNER_DIR="$HOME/actions-runner"
REPO_URL="https://github.com/jleechanorg/your-project.com"
Copilot AI
33 minutes ago
The repository URL is hardcoded and contains project-specific organization details. For a generic infrastructure script, this should either be derived from the current git remote or accept a parameter to make it reusable across different projects.

Suggested change
REPO_URL="https://github.com/jleechanorg/your-project.com"
# Determine repository URL: argument > env var > git remote > error
REPO_URL=""
# Parse --repo argument
while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
    case "$1" in
        --repo)
            REPO_URL="$2"
            shift 2
            ;;
        *)
            shift
            ;;
    esac
done
# If not set by argument, check environment variable
if [[ -z "$REPO_URL" && -n "$REPO_URL" ]]; then
    REPO_URL="$REPO_URL"
fi
# If still not set, try to get from git remote
if [[ -z "$REPO_URL" ]]; then
    if git rev-parse --is-inside-work-tree >/dev/null 2>&1; then
        REPO_URL="$(git config --get remote.origin.url)"
    fi
fi
# If still not set, print warning and exit
if [[ -z "$REPO_URL" ]]; then
    echo -e "${RED}❌ Repository URL not specified. Use --repo <url> or set REPO_URL env variable.${NC}"
    exit 1
fi
